item.title: [DISTRELEC-6569] WG: Wrong price displayed on webshop
item.description:
Actions
Please check the issue below reported from one of the business-testers. Have a look at the screenshots. If it's an SAP-Issue, please attache request & response, thx.

Original Message
Hello, Evangelos!

We still have a problem, that the web is displaying wrong “Singel List Price” on the second raw on item 2 – 6, when the customer has a discount (in this case 15,5%).

Customer is: 1251241
item.summary: WG: Wrong price displayed on webshop

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
It is an SAP issue. Anyway, here is the SOAP REQ/RESP

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
	<soap:Body>
		<ns2:OrderCalculationRequest xmlns:ns2="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">
			<salesOrganization>7640</salesOrganization>
			<simulateOrder>true</simulateOrder>
			<customerData>
				<customerId>0001251241</customerId>
				<contactId>0000338364</contactId>
				<shippingAddressId>0001251241</shippingAddressId>
			</customerData>
			<orderEntries>
				<materialNumber>30002886</materialNumber>
				<quantity>1</quantity>
				<freeGiftPromotion>false</freeGiftPromotion>
			</orderEntries>
			<orderEntries>
				<materialNumber>11028278</materialNumber>
				<quantity>57</quantity>
				<freeGiftPromotion>false</freeGiftPromotion>
			</orderEntries>
			<selectedPaymentMethodCode>Z115</selectedPaymentMethodCode>
			<selectedShippingMethodCode>N1</selectedShippingMethodCode>
			<freeShippingPromotion>false</freeShippingPromotion>
			<editableByAllContacts>false</editableByAllContacts>
		</ns2:OrderCalculationRequest>
	</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

<SOAP:Envelope xmlns:SOAP='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'>
	<SOAP:Header/>
	<SOAP:Body>
		<ns1:OrderCalculationResponse xmlns:ns1='http://www.distrelec.com/hybris'>
			<orderEntries>
				<materialNumber>30002886</materialNumber>
				<orderQuantity>1</orderQuantity>
				<freeGiftPromotion>false</freeGiftPromotion>
				<listPrice>6.45</listPrice>
				<listPriceTotal>6.45</listPriceTotal>
				<actualPrice>5.45</actualPrice>
				<actualPriceTotal>5.45</actualPriceTotal>
				<availabilityInfo>
					<availableQuantity>0</availableQuantity>
					<estimatedDeliveryDate>20150318</estimatedDeliveryDate>
				</availabilityInfo>
			</orderEntries>
			<orderEntries>
				<materialNumber>11028278</materialNumber>
				<orderQuantity>57</orderQuantity>
				<freeGiftPromotion>false</freeGiftPromotion>
				<listPrice>5.71</listPrice>
				<listPriceTotal>325.47</listPriceTotal>
				<actualPrice>4.82</actualPrice>
				<actualPriceTotal>275.02</actualPriceTotal>
				<availabilityInfo>
					<availableQuantity>0</availableQuantity>
					<estimatedDeliveryDate>20150318</estimatedDeliveryDate>
				</availabilityInfo>
			</orderEntries>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>WB01</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>WB02</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>WB03</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<paymentMethods>
				<code>Z115</code>
				<price>0.0</price>
				<selected>true</selected>
			</paymentMethods>
			<shippingMethods>
				<code>E1</code>
				<price>85.0</price>
				<selected>false</selected>
			</shippingMethods>
			<shippingMethods>
				<code>N1</code>
				<price>39.0</price>
				<selected>true</selected>
			</shippingMethods>
			<subtotal1>331.92</subtotal1>
			<shippingPrice>39.0</shippingPrice>
			<discounts>
				<fixedValue>51.45</fixedValue>
				<percentage>15.5</percentage>
			</discounts>
			<subtotal2>280.47</subtotal2>
			<tax>79.87</tax>
			<total>399.34</total>
		</ns1:OrderCalculationResponse>
	</SOAP:Body>
</SOAP:Envelope>
Please check, thx

Hello Nabil,
Is not an SAP issue. We return the normal price and the total.
Webshop is showing the total at the place where the actualPrice should be shown.
Please check again
I tried with the same customer but I was not able to reproduce the issue (see the last screenshot). The SOAP req/resp in my previous comment represents the same screenshot.

Hello Nabil,
Try to add more items in the cart and play with the quantities and it will probably happen.
The problem occurs only when you add an article via the direct order and you click on recalculate. The ajax template takes the wrong value.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6559] WebShop Help - Bug
item.description:
Importance
Normal

Ticket Creater
Rahn, Cord

E-Mail Address
cord.rahn@distrelec.com

Created
2015-02-06T07:30:12Z

Type of feedback
Bug    

URL of the page where error / mistake was found
http://www.distrelec.de/de/Feuchtemessumformer-E%2BE-Elektronik-EE300Ex-HT6SAxBxxxD1AT-MTx052UW-%2B-HA0114/p/30010255?q=300-10-255&page=1&origPos=1&origPageSize=10&simi=99.0

OS / Type of Device            
MS Windows 8.1/ PC

Browser used
Internet Explorer 10,Other

Description
Product Detail pageProduct Family tabIf you click on more, the Price field of the more articles is corrupt.Please decode the formatting code before limiting to 12-13 characters.
[Created via e-mail received from: <"WebShop Help"@Sharepoint>]

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I could reproduce the issue with the first article I tried 100000, click on "Product Family" tab more than once, then click on the "Display More" button and you'll get the Price tag instead of the Price for the other.
This is a FE bug not a BE. Please assign to FE engineer.
OK, thanks for checking - will assign to Ruben.

Please test after the next deployment
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6552] Detailpage Similar Search // Remove text if no web use A
item.description: If we have no web use A Attribute (Attributes with checkboxes) on the product detail page please fade out the on the screenshot marked text, similar to the search button.
item.summary: Detailpage Similar Search // Remove text if no web use A

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate
The text on the box of the left side of the button should be greyed out like the text on the button if no attributes are selected.

Please test
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6543] ELFA (Q) - direct order with old elfa numbers
item.description:
Direct-order functionality does not support old ELFA product numbers:
Example 175-59-959 but if we use 17559959 it is working!

Requirement
The direct-order functionality should be able to handle old ELFA product-numbers (only in ELFA-case).
item.summary: ELFA (Q) - direct order with old elfa numbers

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: High-level estimate: 2h
fixed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6498] Customer migration Job - Process stuck if file is not in correct location
item.description:
The customer-migration job gets stuck if the file is not in the correct place. This leads to stuck java-processes on the server which needs a restart of them afterwards.

If this would happen on HP-P, then we'd have to restart the servers and cancel all running imports. This would be a serious problem then.
item.summary: Customer migration Job - Process stuck if file is not in correct location

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please add what you found out yesterday if still available, thx.
Please estimate.

We have to discuss this ticket.
Could you please remember me the date in which we have observed this problem in Q system?
I think it was the 25th or 26th of february.

The migration job contains a asynchronous task that waits for 10s to start. Since you tested with a small file that take few milliseconds of execution, so the cronjob will wait for the termination of the asynchronous task. I run the migration job with the configured file "SE_EXPORT_Q_System_testData.csv" and it terminates correctly after 10 sec.

Hi Nabil, please investigate the issue. The script works but If the file is not present, HMC gets completely stuck and corresponding node needs a restart. This could be a real issue if it would occur on P. It should not be possible to create such a situation on P, can we cover that?
I updated the code to terminate the cronjob in case the file is not found.
great, thx nabil

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6382] OCI // Possibility to fade out the footer
item.description:
We need the possibility to fade out the normal footer an fade in a specific OCI/ARIBA footer per customer.
This definition should be possible to handle through the HMC customer configuration --> OCI Footer: On/Off

The specific OCI/Ariba footer should only contain

  • Copyright
  • AGB
  • Impressum
  • Data privacy

You can use the cart footer.
item.summary: OCI // Possibility to fade out the footer

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please review.

Hi Surendra
If it's activated I see both footers.
Tried with: https://test.distrelec.ch/ociEntry?username=webmaster@distrelec.com&password=123456&hook_url=http://q08.elfa.se:50000/elfa3/catalogdb/DisplayParametersServlet&oci_version=4.0
THis is still not solved.

Hi Florian,
It is frontend issues. But I will correct it now.

Hi Ruben,
I have done something regarding the footer Could we check out togther please.

as agreed with Surendra, Newsletter and USP links will be hidden for OCI/Ariba users
Please test
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6317] Error during punch-out-filter import - more than one item found for '280401'
item.description:
The yesterdays console.log contains the following error more than 800'000 times:

03 Feb 2015 00:00:00 ERROR [ImpExWorker<1/3>] (00004RIW) [MultiThreadedImpExImportReader] line 29177 at main script: worker 1 got error more than one item found for '280401' using query ' FROM {Company AS t0} WHERE {t0.erpCustomerID}=?v0 ' with values {v0=280401} - got at least 4982835d-6ec7-4433-bea4-a4a8a43934be[8798184964101] and c8d367f3-d578-4012-9f4a-b59b58a0b49e[8810985062405]
de.hybris.platform.jalo.JaloInvalidParameterException: more than one item found for '280401' using query ' FROM {Company AS t0} WHERE {t0.erpCustomerID}=?v0 ' with values {v0=280401} - got at least 4982835d-6ec7-4433-bea4-a4a8a43934be[8798184964101] and c8d367f3-d578-4012-9f4a-b59b58a0b49e[8810985062405][HY-0]
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.translators.ItemExpressionTranslator.searchCombined(ItemExpressionTranslator.java:1575)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.translators.ItemExpressionTranslator.convertAllToJalo(ItemExpressionTranslator.java:1452)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultValueLineTranslator.translateColumnValues(DefaultValueLineTranslator.java:97)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultExistingItemResolver.translateUniqueKeys(DefaultExistingItemResolver.java:443)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultExistingItemResolver.createQueryParameters(DefaultExistingItemResolver.java:256)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultExistingItemResolver.findExisting(DefaultExistingItemResolver.java:91)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultImportProcessor.processItemData_Impl(DefaultImportProcessor.java:170)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultImportProcessor.processItemData(DefaultImportProcessor.java:121)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.MultiThreadedImportProcessor.processItemData(MultiThreadedImportProcessor.java:102)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.MultiThreadedImpExImportReader.processValueLineFromWorker(MultiThreadedImpExImportReader.java:487)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.ImpExWorker.perform(ImpExWorker.java:146)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.ImpExWorker.run(ImpExWorker.java:80)
        at de.hybris.platform.util.threadpool.PoolableThread.run(PoolableThread.java:198)
item.summary: Error during punch-out-filter import - more than one item found for '280401'

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
@Florian: It's most probably related to the punchout filter CSV (erp_punchoutfilt_cu-D1P275-20150202232447000.csv).
I will not have time to analyse further today. If urgent, please assign to somebody. Otherwise I will take care about this problem tomorrow.

Yes the issue is related erp_punchoutfilt_cu (Punchout at Customer level) because the erpCustomerId is not unique (for example 280401 erp customer Id).
At the moment we can have the same erpCustomerId but in different sales organization.
I will investigate if it's possible to fix the impex import.

The solution discussed is to modify the data model removing the hard relation between DistCUPunchOutFilter and the Company.
This hard relation must be replaced by a light relation, adding the following fields to the DistCUPunchOutFilter type:

<attribute qualifier="salesOrg" type="DistSalesOrg">
	<persistence type="property" />
	<description>Sales organization responsible for SAP Customer</description>
</attribute>
<attribute qualifier="erpCustomerID" type="java.lang.String">
	<persistence type="property" />
	<description>ERP Customer ID</description>
</attribute>

This will allow the punchout impex import to handle the same erpCustomerID against multiple B2BUnit either in the same SalesOrganization or in different ones.
The same logic must be applied to DistManufacturerPunchOutFilter, so we have to create the same two attribute in this type.

Hi Will
i've changed the data model definition in hybris and adjusted al the code to the new data model.

Could you please check and review my changes?

Just had a quick look at the data model. I think...

  • DistManufacturerPunchOutFilter.salesOrg is missing (erpCustomerID is not enough as key)
  • For DistManufacturerPunchOutFilter both attributes salesOrg and erpCustomerID should be optional="false" and unique="true"
  • For DistCUPunchOutFilter the attribute erpCustomerID should be optional="false"
  • Most probably you have to redeclare salesOrg in DistCUPunchOutFilter (already defined by DistSalesOrgPunchOutFilter) in order to have it optional="false" and unique="true"
Data model changes are done. Committed in v3.2. ready for Q deployment. After Q deployment we need to change the SAP interface and do testing.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6131] Searchfilter 24h missing
item.description:
Daniela: "Wenn ein Filter (oder ein Wert) fehlt, dann hat FF in der Regel keine Daten – so auch hier. Im Feed sind ausschliesslich 0 und 1 vorhanden (s.u., 0 = not on stock, 1=7days, 2= on stock). Bitte prüfen warum wir nur diese Werte haben – und die 2 wieder erhältlich machen"

English: If a filter (or value) is missing, then FF has usually also no data - also in this case. In the Feed are only 0 and 1 present. (0 = not on stock, 1=7days, 2= on stock)
Please check why we only have only those values and make the "2" available again, thx.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Feedback from the FF meeting

1. Where is the issue? Hybris or FF? -> Rafael can you pls identify at least one or more products on P?
2. Then we will see if the problem is in hybris or FF
3. We can fix the problem when we know in which system the issue is

  • Check general availability logic with Florian
  • Stocklevels you find in the hmc under Inventory->Stocklevels

The issue is already present in the FF-Export. See attached screenshot - stock-status "2" is missing. Please check an actual factfinder export - there you'll find products and the corresponding stock-levels(0/1/2). Please check why we don't have stock-status "2" anymore in the export.

Hi Florian

I need the general information about the availability logic for this ticket. From hybris we export the "InStock"-status as 0 1 or 2. 2 is for 24 hours. The exported value depends on the stocklevel value. At the moment there is no value 2 exported from hybris for FF channel ch_de. But in the frontend we display 24 hours availability for some products. We need to change the frontend logic or the FF export query, to have the same logic for the each case (FE & FF). Lets discuss this shortly together.

This is the export query for the "InStock" value in FF:

            SELECT s.productpk, (CASE WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 128 THEN 2 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >=96 THEN 1 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 64 THEN 0 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 40 THEN 2 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 32 THEN 1 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 24 THEN 2 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >=16 THEN 0 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 8 THEN 2 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >=6 THEN 1 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 5 THEN 0 WHEN sum(s.inStock) >= 2 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS InStock
                FROM ({{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, (CASE WHEN sum({sl.available}) > 0 THEN 128 ELSE 64 END) AS InStock
                        FROM {Product AS p JOIN StockLevel AS sl ON {p.code} = {sl.productCode}}
                    WHERE
                        (
                            {sl.warehouse} IN
                            ({{
                                SELECT {wh.pk}
                                    FROM {Warehouse AS wh
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseExclusiveFast AS rel ON {rel.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite AS cms ON {cms.pk} = {rel.source} AND {cms.pk} = 8796093187112 }
                            }})
                        ) GROUP BY {p.pk}
                }}
                UNION ALL {{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, (CASE WHEN sum({sl.available}) > 0 THEN 32 ELSE 16 END) AS InStock
                        FROM {Product AS p JOIN StockLevel AS sl ON {p.code} = {sl.productCode}}
                    WHERE
                        (
                            {sl.warehouse} IN
                            ({{
                                SELECT {wh.pk}
                                    FROM {Warehouse AS wh
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseExclusiveSlow AS rel ON {rel.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite AS cms ON {cms.pk} = {rel.source} AND {cms.pk} = 8796093187112 }
                            }})
                        ) GROUP BY {p.pk}
                }}
                UNION ALL {{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, (CASE WHEN sum({sl.available}) > 0 THEN 8 ELSE 4 END) AS InStock
                        FROM {Product AS p JOIN StockLevel AS sl ON {p.code} = {sl.productCode}}
                    WHERE
                        (
                            {sl.warehouse} IN
                            ({{
                                SELECT {wh.pk}
                                    FROM {Warehouse AS wh
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseFast AS relFast ON {relFast.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseExternalFast AS relExtFast ON {relExtFast.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite AS cms ON {cms.pk} = {relFast.source} AND {cms.pk} = {relExtFast.source} AND {cms.pk} = 8796093187112 }
                            }})
                        ) GROUP BY {p.pk}
                }}
                UNION ALL {{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, (CASE WHEN sum({sl.available}) > 0 THEN 2 ELSE 1 END) AS InStock
                        FROM {Product AS p JOIN StockLevel AS sl ON {p.code} = {sl.productCode}}
                    WHERE
                        (
                            {sl.warehouse} IN
                            ({{
                                SELECT {wh.pk}
                                    FROM {Warehouse AS wh
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseSlow AS relSlow ON {relSlow.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite2WarehouseExternalSlow AS relExtSlow ON {relExtSlow.target} = {wh.PK}
                                    JOIN CMSSite AS cms ON {cms.pk} = {relSlow.source} AND {cms.pk} = {relExtSlow.source} AND {cms.pk} = 8796093187112 }
                            }})
                        ) GROUP BY {p.pk}
                }}
                UNION ALL
                {{
                    SELECT {p.pk} AS productpk, 0 AS InStock
                        FROM {product AS p}
                }}) s
            GROUP BY s.productpk

Cheers
Will

Please check the FF export process.

Correct behaviour would be:
Not in stock = 0
External Warehouse = 1
in stock = 2

Today's situation:
Not in stock = 0
External Warehouse = 1
in stock = 1 --> NOT OK
Looks like the problem was introduced by DISTRELEC-5692. There, some wrong SQL join statements do not honor "fast warehouses" anymore.

Fixed bug in warehouse selection.
I did the fix in the following FF-Export queries only:

  • DistFactFinderProductExportQueryCreator (currently active)
  • DistFactFinderProductExportQueryCreatorV6DQ (most probably the upcomming version used with DQ)

Please test

  • on D as of tomorrow
  • on Q as soon as v3.2.13 is deployed on test
  • on P as soon as v3.2.13 is deployed on production

(also fixed the issue that some FF exports were running on node1 instead of node0)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4660] Wrong availability information in FF
item.description: Stock information for products available within >7 days is incorrect in FF. Instead of a 0, I receive a 1, which breaks the ranking rule for showing the available products first.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Daniela,
Is this issue appearing since today?
We deployed some stock modifications yesterday evening. Maybe this should be solved after the next FF import.
This issue appears since around the change from 72hrs to 7 days. I observed it for a while, but it does not go away. I checked with the 717551 again, and it's still the same. 1 instead of 0.

The issue seems to get worse: I now even have products on stock (according to shop display) and indicated with 0 in FF, messing up the entire sorting.

E.g. 885304

Sorry, wrong article no. This query here is a "nice" example: http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=clicktronic
The available products (according to shop) are at the bottom, cause I get 0 as availability indicator in FF. Setting the availability filter makes things even more interesting:
http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=clicktronic&filter_InStock=1

I've checked some examples and I didn't find any differences anymore.
Same on your side?

Unfortunately, it seems not to be entirely fixed.

E.g. when searching for Messgeräte in CH-DE, we have in the shop 7d and >7d, but in FF I always have 1. Same in a case when I search for fish.

So it's still not entirely fixed.
@Daniela: You are right, we missed one case!
@Raphael
Please close if there is nothing to be done anymore.

Has the issue that we do not receive correct availability been fixed with the deployment now?
I don't see anything in my feeds - but they are old, also.

Please trigger exports so that we can check.

Thanks.

Availabilty information (instock) still not fixed. We still only get 1 and 0 in the feed. Ranking rules are not working anymore and products are shown on top, which are not available. Logistics and hence the rest of the company suffers from this.

So we need an urgent solution here as we've had this situation now since the beginning of the year.

/Daniela

Please check the FF export process.

Correct behaviour would be:
Not in stock = 0
External Warehouse = 1
in stock = 2

Today's situation:
Not in stock = 0
External Warehouse = 1
in stock = 1 --> NOT OK

Hi Florian

Any news on that?

/Daniela

Hi Daniela,
Not yet. First we have to understand the complete logic of this. We are thinking about to refactor this functionality.

Hi Flo

Any idea when we can expect a solution?

/Daniela

I will discuss it on the team meeting on Monday.
After this meeting I'll come up with a estimated due date.
Is this okay for you?

Hi Florian

Any news on that?

/Daniela

http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-6131 :

Adrian Scherrer Namics:
Fixed bug in warehouse selection.
I did the fix in the following FF-Export queries only:
DistFactFinderProductExportQueryCreator (currently active)
DistFactFinderProductExportQueryCreatorV6DQ (most probably the upcomming version used with DQ)
Please test
on D as of tomorrow
on Q as soon as v3.2.13 is deployed on test
on P as soon as v3.2.13 is deployed on production
(also fixed the issue that some FF exports were running on node1 instead of node0)
